Model¶

Mapped model from the API.

Error¶

class pymultimatic.model.status.Error(device_name: str, title: str, status_code: str, description: str, timestamp: datetime.datetime)¶

Errors coming from your system.

Parameters

  • device_name (str) – Name of the device from where the error is coming.

  • title (str) – Short description of the error.

  • status_code (str) – Code of the error.

  • description (str) – Long description of the error.

  • timestamp (datetime) – When errors occurred.

BoilerStatus¶

class pymultimatic.model.status.BoilerStatus(device_name: str, title: str, status_code: str, description: str, timestamp: datetime.datetime, hint: str)¶

Status of the boiler. This is sent with an error format, but in this case, it’s more like a status.

Parameters

hint (str) – Directly coming from the API, most of the time the value is ...

property is_error¶

Checks if there is an error at boiler side.

Type

bool

SystemInfo¶

class pymultimatic.model.system.SystemInfo(gateway: str, serial_number: str, name: str, mac_ethernet: str, mac_wifi: str, firmware: str, online: str, update: str)¶

“Information about the system.

Parameters

  • gateway (str) – Gateway type;

  • serial_number (str) – Serial number of the installation.

  • name (str) – Name of the installation.

  • mac_ethernet (str) – Mac address of ethernet.

  • mac_wifi (str) – Mac address of wifi.

  • firmware (str) – Firmware version.

  • online (str) – Indicate if the system is connected to the cloud.

  • update (str) – Indicate if there is available update.

property is_online¶

Checks if the system is connected to the internet.

Type

bool

property is_up_to_date¶

Checks if the system is up to date.

Type

bool

SyncState¶

class pymultimatic.model.syncstate.SyncState(state: str, timestamp: datetime.datetime, resource_link: str)¶

Sync state coming from the API. In the vaillant API, most resource you can ask for are flagged with a resourceState, with that, you can know if the resource you are asking for is synced or not.

Parameters

  • state (str) – Sate coming from the API.

  • timestamp (datetime) – state’s last update.

  • resource_link (str) – Link to the resource the state is talking about.

property is_init¶

Check if state is initializing.

Type

bool

property is_outdated¶

Check if state is outdated.

Type

bool

property is_pending¶

Check if state is pending.

Type

bool

property is_synced¶

Check if state is synced.

Type

bool

TimePeriodSetting¶

class pymultimatic.model.timeprogram.TimePeriodSetting(start_time: str, target_temperature: Optional[float], setting: Optional[pymultimatic.model.mode.SettingMode])¶

This is a period setting, defining what the Component should do when on AUTO.

There is not end of the period, the end of the period is equal to the start time of the next period.

Parameters

  • start_time (str) – Start time of the period, format is HH:mm.

  • target_temperature (float) – Target temperature to reach during this

  • period, target temperature is only available for (time) – Room.

  • setting (SettingMode) – The setting configured, see SettingModes, this is not available for a Room.

absolute_minutes¶

Represents start_time in absolute minute. hours * 60 + minutes. This is more convenient to compare TimePeriodSetting using this.

hour¶

Hour at which the setting is starting.

minute¶

Minute at which the setting is starting.

TimeProgramDay¶

class pymultimatic.model.timeprogram.TimeProgramDay(settings: List[pymultimatic.model.timeprogram.TimePeriodSetting])¶

This is a day, this is basically a list of TimePeriodSetting.

Parameters

settings (List[TimePeriodSetting]) – List of periods for this day.

TimeProgram¶

class pymultimatic.model.timeprogram.TimeProgram(days: Dict[str, pymultimatic.model.timeprogram.TimeProgramDay])¶

This is the full time program, a week, reflecting the configuration done through mobile app.

Parameters

days (Dict[str, TimeProgramDay]) – Days of the week.

get_for(search_date: datetime.datetime) → pymultimatic.model.timeprogram.TimePeriodSetting¶

Get the corresponding TimePeriodSetting for the given time.

Parameters

search_date (datetime) – Only the day, the hour and minute are used in order to get the right TimePeriodSetting.

Returns

The corresponding setting.

Return type

TimePeriodSetting

get_next(search_date: datetime.datetime) → pymultimatic.model.timeprogram.TimePeriodSetting¶

Get the next TimePeriodSetting for the given time. So if there is a time program like this:

  • 5:00

  • 6:00

And It’s 5:30, it will return the second one

Parameters

search_date (datetime) – Only the day, the hour and minute are used in order to get the right TimePeriodSetting.

Returns

The corresponding setting.

Return type

TimePeriodSetting
